title: Brazil's Bolsonaro denies illegal acts with seized jewelry
description: Brazil’s former president Jair Bolsonaro says he did nothing illegal following reports that he tried to bring jewelry worth more than $3 million into the country in 2021 without declaring it to authorities

title: US military commander in Syria briefed on anti-IS operations
description: The top U.S. military commander has visited northeast Syria where American troops and their allies are launching a campaign against the Islamic State group

title: Station master in Greece train crash delays court appearance
description: The station master involved in Greece’s deadliest train crash postponed his deposition and is now set to appear before a prosecutor and an examining magistrate on Sunday

title: Israelis protest legal overhaul plans for 9th week
description: Tens of thousands of Israelis are protesting Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu’s contentious plan to overhaul the legal system in the country, as the government pressed on with the proposed changes despite the mass opposition

title: UN nuclear head meets with Iranians amid enrichment concerns
description: The head of the U.N. nuclear watchdog has met with officials in Iran

title: Ukraine: Mourners commemorate 8 men killed in Bucha
description: Neighbors and friends of eight men executed by Russian forces during the occupation of the Ukrainian town of Bucha have gathered to mark the first anniversary of the deaths

title: Lawyers fight for man they say US wrongly deported to Haiti
description: Paul Pierrilus was deported two years ago from the U.S. to Haiti where he has been trying to survive in a chaotic and violent country where he wasn’t born and had never lived

title: Climate activists target art work near German parliament
description: Climate activists have splashed a dark liquid over an art work near the German parliament building engraved with key articles from the country’s constitution, drawing condemnation from the speaker of parliament and other lawmakers

title: Bus with 40 children crashes in French Alps; 21 injured
description: French authorities say a bus carrying 40 elementary school students home from a trip to the French Alps plunged down a wooded slope into a creek Saturday

title: Woman completes quintessentially English mission to eat 244 scones across U.K.
description: Sarah Merker spent a decade touring stately homes and National Trust properties while sampling their scones, calling her journey a “double whammy of Britishness.”

title: Spain arrests two for sexually exploiting 120 women using model agency
description: The suspects coerced the women into prostitution and forced some of their victims to wear geolocation devices, police said after the arrests in Elche, Alicante.

title: Rafael Viñoly, architect of global landmarks and civic spaces, dies at 78
description: After designing a stadium for the 1978 World Cup in Argentina, Mr. Viñoly fled during the military junta then ruling the country.

title: Civilians flee embattled town as Ukrainian pullout looms
description: Pressure is mounting on Ukrainian troops holding out in Bakhmut, with the Ukrainian army trying to help civilians flee the beleaguered eastern town

title: South Sudan's president dismisses political rival's wife
description: South Sudan’s president has dismissed his defense minister, the wife of his longtime political rival, Riek Machar

title: Doctor in embattled Somaliland city says at least 145 dead
description: The director of a hospital in a disputed city in the Somaliland region says at least 145 people have been killed in more than two months of fighting between anti-government fighters and Somaliland security forces after local elders declared their intention to reunite with Somalia

title: UN nuclear head meets with Iranians amid enrichment concerns
description: The head of the U.N. nuclear watchdog is meeting with officials in Iran

title: Phone scammers tried to rob a grandma in Canada. She foiled their plans.
description: A scammer pretended to be her grandson and claimed he was in need of thousands of dollars. She set him up, leading to two arrests.

title: Thai cave boy's ashes arrive home from UK for final farewell
description: The cremated ashes of one of the 12 boys rescued from a flooded cave in 2018 have arrived in the far northern Thai province of Chiang Rai where final Buddhist rites for his funeral will be held over the next few days following his death in the U.K. Duangphet “Dom” Phromthep, 17, was found unconscious in his room on Feb. 12 at the Brooke House College Football Academy in Leicestershire and was taken to a hospital, where he died two days later

title: Ukraine plant builds 6-person bunkers for war's front lines
description: The pops of welding torches and the piecing whine of angle grinders fill the spacious production floor at a steel plant in central Ukraine

title: Divorced and remarried, these Afghan women are outlaws under Taliban rule
description: Taliban law voids thousands of divorces, experts say, and now considers many remarried women to be adulterers.

title: Defying attacks, arts return to Somalia with first TV drama in 30 years
description: A series revolving around the lives of high school students is the first drama shot in Somalia for more than three decades.

title: Ukraine live briefing: U.S. attorney general makes surprise Ukraine visit, vows to pursue Russian war criminals
description: Merrick Garland made an unannounced appearance at a meeting of law enforcement officials in Lviv, while Ukrainian forces battled to hold the city of Bakhmut.

title: UN report: Modern weapons being smuggled to Haiti from US
description: Increasingly sophisticated weapons are being trafficked into Haiti mainly from the United States and especially from Florida amid worsening lawlessness in the impoverished Caribbean nation, according to a new U.N. report
